Description: Axe-head: with rounded blade. Unlike other axes of the type, it is relatively thin with a flat, even, profile. It is moderately corroded. Marks of a grinding tool are present on the cutting edge, as well as on the sides and the edges of the butt. The cutting edge has been blunted through use.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (24)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
